replies.body: You can use EnergyPlus to calculate that. [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/qB*eEYpVu7PUFYsATfWXtxczzTW6hVfsgJL7uZw-yBER5rDv6Vzhnjpe5iGqZuWNhcnFGL6yvxePfXXSSUkveRU5yrqoD3na/glazingSolarOutput.png)

Thanks Mostapha!



I'm quite new at this so excuse the follow up question. If I was trying to calculate the shading coefficient of the glass, I would only need the beam solar radiation? Beam sounds like direct sunlight.



Edit: Nevermind, I stopped being lazy. Thanks again!



Kind regards,

Theodore.
